# Day1 - SQL Business Insights
This document explains the business meaning behind the SQL queries written on Day1.
The Goal is to translate the raw data into decisions.
---
## Query1 - Total revenue per customer

***What the query does***
--Groups all orders by 'customer_id'
--Calculates total revenue generated by each customer using 'SUM(amount)'

***Business Meaning***
--Shows which customer contributes the most to overall revenue

***Why this matters***
--Not all customers are equally valuable
--High revenue customers drive a large portion of business income

***Actionable Insights***
--Prioritize retention strategies for top customers
--Offer loyalty programmes

## Query2 - Total revenue by city

***What the query does***
--Joins 'customers' and 'orders'
--Aggregate revenue at the city level

***Business Meaning***
-Identifies which cities generate the most revenue

***Why this matters***
--Helps understand geographic performance
--Reveals hig performing and under performing regions

***Actionable Insights***
--Increase marketing spend in high-performing cities
--Investigate reasons for low revenue in weaker regions

##Query3 - Customers with revenue greater than 10,000

***What the query does***
--Groups revenue by customer
--Filters customers whose total revenue exceeds a threshold using 'HAVING' 

***Business Meaning***
--To identify a premium or high value customers

***Why this matters***
--A small group of customers share a large revenue

***Actionable Insights***
--Assign account managers to these customers
--Provide exclusive benefits to prevent churn

##Query4 - Orders sorted by highest amount

***What the query does***
--Sort all orders by order amount in descending order

***Business Meaning***
--Highlights the largest individual transactions

***Why this matters***
--Larger orders may indicate bulk orders or special purchasing behaviour

***Actionable Insights***
--Analyze pattern behind large purchases
--Create target upsell or bulk pricing strategies

##Query5 - Daily total revenue

***What the query does***
--Calculate orders by date
--Calculate total revenue per day

***Business Meaning***
--Show revenue trends overtime

***Why this matters***
--Helps identify peak sales days and seasonal trends
--Useful for forecasting and capacity planning

***Actionable Insights***
--Align inventory and staffing with high revenue days
--Plan promotions during low-revenue periods
